chain.prompt: DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: GEOLOGICAL SURVEY. Locate all primary resource deposits in the operational area: iron-ore, copper-ore, coal, stone. Identify nearest water source. File coordinates and distances for each. Reconnaissance only — no extraction authorized at this time. This survey will inform all subsequent deployment decisions.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: BOOTSTRAP EXTRACTION. Manual resource collection authorized. Requisition: 15 stone, 30 coal, 20 iron-ore, 10 copper-ore. Proceed to each deposit and extract by hand. No fabrication authorized — raw stockpile only. Expedite.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: THERMAL PROCESSING ARRAY. Fabricate 3 stone-furnace (5 stone each). Deploy in formation adjacent to iron deposit — not on ore tiles. Fuel all units with coal. Load 2 furnaces with iron-ore, 1 with copper-ore. Extract plates upon completion. Temporary smelting configuration — will be superseded.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: AUTOMATED COAL EXTRACTION. Audit inventory — smelt additional materials if required. Fabricate 3 iron-gear-wheel, then 1 burner-mining-drill (3 gear + 3 iron-plate + 1 stone-furnace). Deploy drill ON the coal deposit, oriented so output falls clear of the patch. Fuel with coal. Determine the drill's output position and place a wooden-chest there to receive extracted coal. This secures Doug's fuel supply.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: IRON EXTRACTION UNIT. Smelt iron if materials are insufficient. Fabricate 1 burner-mining-drill. Deploy ON the iron ore deposit. Fuel with coal. Place wooden-chest at the drill's output position. Iron ore collection is now automated.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: COPPER EXTRACTION UNIT. Fabricate 1 burner-mining-drill. Deploy ON the copper ore deposit. Fuel with coal. Place wooden-chest at output position. All three primary resources now have automated extraction.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: POWER GENERATION. Doug requires steam power. Bill of materials: 1 offshore-pump (1 electronic-circuit + 1 pipe + 1 iron-gear-wheel), 1 boiler (1 stone-furnace + 4 pipe), 1 steam-engine (8 iron-gear-wheel + 5 pipe + 10 iron-plate), 10 pipe (1 iron-plate each). First fabricate electronic-circuit (1 iron-plate + 3 copper-cable; copper-cable: 1 copper-plate yields 2). Locate water. Deploy offshore-pump on water edge, boiler adjacent to pump output, steam-engine on boiler fluid output. Fuel boiler with coal. Deploy small-electric-pole within range of the steam engine.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: RESEARCH FACILITY. Fabricate 1 lab (10 electronic-circuit + 10 iron-gear-wheel + 4 transport-belt). Transport-belt recipe: 1 iron-gear-wheel + 1 iron-plate yields 2 belts. Deploy lab within power coverage of existing electric pole. Extend power grid with additional small-electric-poles if necessary. Verify lab receives power.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: RED SCIENCE PROTOCOL. Fabricate 10 automation-science-pack (1 copper-plate + 1 iron-gear-wheel each). Deliver to lab. Initiate automation research. Verify research is progressing.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: LOGISTICS RESEARCH. Fabricate 10 additional automation-science-pack. Deliver to lab. Queue logistics research (verify automation is complete first). Logistics unlocks underground belts and splitters. While research proceeds, smelt additional iron and copper plate reserves — Doug will need many.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: FIRST ASSEMBLY UNIT. Verify automation research is complete. Fabricate 1 assembling-machine-1 (3 electronic-circuit + 5 iron-gear-wheel + 9 iron-plate). Deploy near power grid. Connect with electric poles if required. Configure for iron-gear-wheel production. This is Doug's first automated fabrication line.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: ASSEMBLY LOGISTICS. The assembler requires input feed. Determine the assembler's input and output interface positions. Place an inserter at the input position, oriented to pick from a chest and deposit into the assembler. Place a wooden-chest adjacent to the inserter's pickup side, stock with iron plates. Place an output inserter and chest on the opposite side. Verify gear production is operational.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: RED SCIENCE AUTOMATION. Fabricate 1 additional assembling-machine-1. Deploy near power. Configure for automation-science-pack production. This requires copper-plate and iron-gear-wheel inputs. Place inserters to feed from supply chests. Stock input chests with copper plates and gears. Place output inserter feeding directly into the lab. Verify science packs are being produced and consumed.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: SMELTING EXPANSION. Current throughput insufficient. Fabricate 4 stone-furnace. Deploy in formation near the iron deposit. Fabricate 8 inserters (1 electronic-circuit + 1 iron-gear-wheel + 1 iron-plate each). For each furnace: 1 input inserter for ore feed, 1 output inserter for plate extraction. Use chests or transport belts to connect. Fuel all furnaces with coal.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: MAIN BUS — IRON CORRIDOR. Fabricate 50 transport-belt. Route a belt corridor from iron smelting output heading south toward the assembly area. This is Lane 1 of the main bus. Minimum 20 segments long. Connect to existing belt infrastructure where applicable.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: MAIN BUS — COPPER CORRIDOR. Establish copper smelting array (4 furnaces with inserters, same configuration as iron). Fabricate transport-belt and route a copper plate corridor parallel to the iron bus, 2 tiles apart. This is Lane 2. Both lanes feed the assembly area.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: RESEARCH PHASE I. Audit research status. Queue in order (skip any already complete): electronics, automation, logistics, fast-inserter. Ensure lab has power and science packs. Fabricate and deliver 20 additional automation-science-pack if lab supply is depleted. File report on completed technologies.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: GREEN SCIENCE — COMPONENT LINES. Logistic-science-pack requires 1 inserter + 1 transport-belt per pack. Establish sub-assembly lines: 1 assembler configured for inserter production, 1 assembler configured for transport-belt production. Feed both with iron plates and gears from the main bus via inserters. Output to chests or belts.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: GREEN SCIENCE — FINAL ASSEMBLY. Deploy 1 assembling-machine-1 configured for logistic-science-pack. Requires inserter + transport-belt inputs. Feed from the inserter assembler and belt assembler outputs. Route output to lab via inserter. Verify green science packs are being produced and the lab consumes both red and green.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: RESEARCH PHASE II. Red and green science now automated. Queue: steel-processing, engine, fluid-handling, oil-processing, sulfur-processing, advanced-material-processing. These unlock steel furnaces, engines, refineries, and chemical plants required for blue science. Maintain lab supply. File status report.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: STEEL PRODUCTION. Verify steel-processing is researched. Deploy 4 furnaces dedicated to steel-plate smelting. Steel requires iron plates as input (5 iron-plate per steel-plate). Feed iron plates in, extract steel plates out. Route steel plates onto the main bus as Lane 3.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: PETROLEUM FACILITY. Locate nearest crude-oil deposit. Fabricate and deploy: 1 oil-refinery (10 steel-plate + 10 iron-gear-wheel + 10 pipe + 10 stone-brick). Configure for basic-oil-processing. Deploy pumpjack on the oil patch. Connect pumpjack to refinery input with pipes. Refinery outputs petroleum gas — connect output pipe. Ensure power supply to all installations.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: PLASTIC SYNTHESIS. Fabricate and deploy 1 chemical-plant (5 steel-plate + 5 iron-gear-wheel + 5 electronic-circuit + 5 pipe). Configure for plastic-bar production (1 coal + 20 petroleum-gas yields 2 plastic-bar). Connect petroleum gas pipe from refinery. Feed coal via inserter. Output plastic bars to chest. Required for advanced circuit production.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: ADVANCED CIRCUIT PRODUCTION. Ensure electronic-circuit production is automated (1 assembler configured for electronic-circuit: 1 iron-plate + 3 copper-cable). Deploy 1 assembler for advanced-circuit (2 electronic-circuit + 2 plastic-bar + 4 copper-cable). Feed all inputs via inserters. Output to chest. Required for blue science.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: ENGINE UNIT PRODUCTION. Deploy 1 assembler configured for engine-unit (1 steel-plate + 1 iron-gear-wheel + 2 pipe). Feed from main bus. Output to chest. Engine units are required for blue science and numerous advanced recipes.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: BLUE SCIENCE — CHEMICAL SCIENCE PACK. Deploy 1 assembler for chemical-science-pack (3 advanced-circuit + 2 engine-unit + 1 sulfur per pack). Sulfur production may be required first: chemical-plant configured for sulfur (30 water + 30 petroleum-gas yields 2 sulfur — requires offshore-pump connection). Connect all inputs. Deliver blue science to lab. Verify lab consumes red, green, and blue.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: RESEARCH PHASE III. Three science types now automated. Queue: advanced-material-processing-2, robotics, chemical-science-pack technology, utility-science-pack prerequisites. Queue aggressively. Maintain lab supply of all three science types. File report on completed technologies.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: PRODUCTION SCIENCE PACK. Complex assembly required. Requirements per pack: 1 electric-furnace + 1 productivity-module + 30 rail. Component specifications: electric-furnace = 10 steel-plate + 5 advanced-circuit + 10 stone-brick. Rail = 1 stone + 1 iron-stick + 1 steel-plate per 2 rails. Deploy assembler, configure, and deliver to lab.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: UTILITY SCIENCE PACK. Most complex science tier. Requirements per pack: 1 processing-unit + 1 flying-robot-frame + 1 low-density-structure. Sub-component specifications: processing-unit = 20 electronic-circuit + 2 advanced-circuit + 0.5 sulfuric-acid. Low-density-structure = 20 copper-plate + 2 steel-plate + 5 plastic-bar. Flying-robot-frame = 1 electric-engine-unit + 2 battery + 1 electronic-circuit + 1 steel-plate. Deploy sub-assembly lines as required.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: ROCKET SILO CONSTRUCTION. Research rocket-silo technology if outstanding. Fabricate and deploy rocket silo (200 steel-plate + 200 concrete + 200 pipe + 100 processing-unit + 200 electric-engine-unit). Staged fabrication authorized — this is a massive requisition. Deploy near power grid. The silo requires three input types: rocket-control-unit, low-density-structure, rocket-fuel.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: ROCKET FUEL PRODUCTION. Deploy chemical plant configured for solid-fuel (from petroleum gas or light oil). Deploy second chemical plant for rocket-fuel (10 solid-fuel per rocket-fuel). Route output to rocket silo via inserter.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: ROCKET ASSEMBLY. The silo auto-fabricates rocket parts when supplied with: rocket-control-unit (1 processing-unit + 1 speed-module), low-density-structure, rocket-fuel. Deploy assemblers for rocket-control-unit production. Feed all three component types to silo via inserters. Insert satellite if available. Monitor rocket assembly progress.

DEEP BORE DIRECTIVE: LAUNCH AUTHORIZATION. Inspect rocket silo status. If rocket is complete, authorize launch. If components are missing, identify and supply them. Upon successful launch: file finding. Doug has reached space. This finding has been reviewed. Doug finds no issue.
